definitions.definition: That which limits the extent of anything; limit, extremity, bound, boundary, terminus .
examples: "Alright, look...we can spend the holidays with your parents, but this time it will be on my terms ."

definitions.definition: A chronological limitation or restriction , a limited timespan .
examples: The term of a lease agreement is the period of time during which the lease is effective, and may be fixed, periodic, or of indefinite duration.

definitions.definition: Any of the binding conditions or promises in a legal contract .
examples: Be sure to read the terms and conditions before signing.

definitions.definition: Specifically, the conditions in a legal contract that specify the price and also how and when payment must be made.
examples: Q: What are your company's terms ? A: Net thirty, cash or check. [This answer means that the net total must be paid within 30 days; see Net D .]
The latest models are available now, on the lowest terms you'll find anywhere, guaranteed.

definitions.definition: ( geometry , archaic ) A point , line , or superficies that limits.
examples: A line is the term of a superficies, and a superficies is the term of a solid.

definitions.definition: A word or phrase (e.g., noun phrase , verb phrase , open compound ), especially one from a specialised area of knowledge; a name for a concept.
examples: "Algorithm" is a term used in computer science.
The noun phrase "red blood cell", the acronym "RBC", and the word "erythrocyte" are synonymous terms .
We are on friendly terms with each other.

definitions.definition: Part of a year , especially one of the divisions of an academic year .
Duration of officeholding, or its limit; period in office of fixed length.
examples: He was sentenced to a term of six years in prison .
near- term , mid- term and long- term goals
the term allowed to a debtor to discharge his debt

subdefinitions.definition: The time during which legal courts are open.
Certain days on which rent is paid.

definitions.definition: With respect to a pregnancy , the usual duration of gestation for the given species (for example, nine months in humans); ( metonymic ) the end of this duration: the timepoint at which birth usually happens (for example, in humans, approximately 40 weeks from conception ), defining the due date .
( of a patent ) The maximum period during which the patent can be maintained into force .
( mathematics ) Any value ( variable or constant ) or expression separated from another term by a space or an appropriate character, in an overall expression or table .
examples: All the terms of this sum cancel out.
One only term is odd in ( 12; 3; 4 ).

definitions.definition: ( logic ) The subject or the predicate of a proposition ; one of the three component parts of a syllogism , each one of which is used twice.
( astrology ) An essential dignity in which unequal segments of every astrological sign have internal rulerships which affect the power and integrity of each planet in a natal chart .
( art ) A statue of the upper body, sometimes without the arms, ending in a pillar or pedestal. [from 17th c.]
( nautical ) A piece of carved work placed under each end of the taffrail .

main_definition: That which limits the extent of anything; limit, extremity, bound, boundary, terminus .
secondary_definitions: A chronological limitation or restriction , a limited timespan .
Any of the binding conditions or promises in a legal contract .
Specifically, the conditions in a legal contract that specify the price and also how and when payment must be made.
( geometry , archaic ) A point , line , or superficies that limits.
A word or phrase (e.g., noun phrase , verb phrase , open compound ), especially one from a specialised area of knowledge; a name for a concept.
Part of a year , especially one of the divisions of an academic year .
Duration of officeholding, or its limit; period in office of fixed length.

With respect to a pregnancy , the usual duration of gestation for the given species (for example, nine months in humans); ( metonymic ) the end of this duration: the timepoint at which birth usually happens (for example, in humans, approximately 40 weeks from conception ), defining the due date .
( of a patent ) The maximum period during which the patent can be maintained into force .
( mathematics ) Any value ( variable or constant ) or expression separated from another term by a space or an appropriate character, in an overall expression or table .
( logic ) The subject or the predicate of a proposition ; one of the three component parts of a syllogism , each one of which is used twice.
( astrology ) An essential dignity in which unequal segments of every astrological sign have internal rulerships which affect the power and integrity of each planet in a natal chart .
( art ) A statue of the upper body, sometimes without the arms, ending in a pillar or pedestal. [from 17th c.]
( nautical ) A piece of carved work placed under each end of the taffrail .

definitions.definition: ( computing , informal ) A computer program that emulates a physical terminal.

main_definition: ( computing , informal ) A computer program that emulates a physical terminal.

definitions.definition: One whose employment has been terminated

main_definition: One whose employment has been terminated
